xxaWHCRzbCk-PxyYBe0gMA.text: Love the beer selection and specials.  Lots of food and drink specials for Happy Hour.  The tater tots are the best!  This place is huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uPkklI8yRGugNG4K76U1tg.text: Went here on a Thursday night for LIVE MUSIC!   What a delight!  Ordered the Prime Steak Salad and regret that I didn't snap a photo.  It had thinly sliced prime steak, done rare to medium rare, and served cold.  It was awesome.  And, truffle fries to boot!  Both the steak and the truffle oil set the flavor of this salad served over fresh mixed greens.  No head lettuce here!  I will definitely be back for this salad!  Oh, and the beer special was a $3 Miller Lite draft.  Aaah.

2dLMi8ynEo7hpN3oSMPCZg.text: The only reason I'm giving it a 2 star instead of 1 is because the bartender was fabulous and we really enjoyed the guys from Sing Sing, but the rest explains why there was about 10 people in the whole bar.  With so few people there I have no idea why they have valet parking.  The food and table service where we sat to eat were terrible.  The waitress spilled water all over our beer menu while refilling and just left it, didn't bother to replace it even though we were still ordering.  It took well over an hour to get our food.  When the food came I said that's not the side salad I ordered, she just said nope it's the craft salad and walked away.  She came back to ask how the food was and never really gave us a chance to answer - my friends had flatbread and I had the chicken thighs.  All of it was burnt to a crisp.  Neither of my friends at even half of their flatbread.  She asked if we wanted boxes and when everyone said no she didn't even question if everything was ok with the food considering it wasn't touched.  Instead of asking if we needed anything else she just took the beer menu away and brought our checks.  When I pointed out I didn't eat my salad because it wasn't what I ordered and it wasn't good she actually argued with me about what I ordered and just said FINE I'll take care of it and walked away.  We moved to the bar where we had more drinks and thankfully finally had good service and entertainment.   I would return for the entertainment, but we would meet elsewhere to eat.

9mkDa5JiCTOO9dyAxp2bpQ.text: Great selection of beers. Very friendly staff...always a plus. Good music, even though I wasn't in for live music. Inventive menu. Had the gyro salad, which was excellent. Ordered wings to go as they make their own sauces. Plus you can bowl a few lanes in the connected alleys.

SaO43XtkitP5qNyeumLS_A.text: The bar was nice and the bartender was attentive. The food however was not very good. The pizza was ok and the wings were borderline awful! Really ... How do you screw up wings. When told that the food was not very good the staff could care less. For the money spent I expected more. The owner sat next to us and could care less that we weren't happy with the food. I may stop back, but only for a drink. I'll go someplace else if we are planning on eating anything at all.

GUZaVXefzz4UzYLZguFsig.text: The atmosphere was nice and we had a good waiter. There was 7 of us and none of us really enjoyed the food. We were pretty disappointed.

lPEkzFTaVT1gNv96Fwzegw.text: Crafthouse is really nice looking bar & valet parking is a nice touch but didn't use. I went their May 7th & it was my first time there & it was a very bad experience left a bad taste  Manager on duty don't care about making customers happy he just walked around. I had to get a waitress to take our order that's after sitting there for about an hour wine prices are different a glass of merlot was $7 at bar & $5 at table??? Food was alright tasted better.  Have a nice bar but if experience was bad that don't mean nothing.Did tell the dingbat of a manager it was my first time there & not coming back I didn't want anything free I just wanted my friends & me to be treated like we mattered. I did tell all my friends about my experience there....word of mouth is best advertisement.

1GHk0HHvZWq3mP40ObGq1w.text: This place is GREAT! January the manager is a pro! Macy the bartender is awsome! Even the dishwasher was professional! Great food! Great bowling! Very relaxed for all ages! Wings awsome! Everything priced right! Beer cold! Great cigar bar.. this is the all-in-one place! Been in industry all my life. Trust me you won't be disappointed. Great work! Way to care bout your guests!

voklJ5NeZeS5UPabkXPFEw.text: I liked the new look.  They even have a cigar bar.   Good food.  Good service I didn't like the valet parking but you can choose to park your own car in a side lot and walk a short distance to the entrance.   It seemed to me that they are trying to make it a nice, safe place to spend an evening.   The band was good and they have in house security.

o7iA_UzNgJVIkEzSCHifkg.text: I was so disappointed with this place. Remodeled and looks good. Understaffed and the little staff they have is rude and slow, I mean really slow. The waitress who had brown hair and a little bigger was really rude. The one with red hair did a good job and was friendly. I ordered drafts and got bottles. They put extra money on my bill. They need to step it up a knotch. Band was good.

JupSE3Ox_NHR0Xc_qlVM6A.text: I love the atmosphere at this place, and they almost always have a solid band playing . The food is sufficient, nothing to write home about, but it's above average for "bar food." However the bartenders don't seem to care too much. There has been numerous occasions where I sat for 15 plus minutes with an empty drink. I was even politely yelling for the bartender and was ignored, mind you the bar was really slow at this point and I was far from drunk, so if I was intentionally ignored I would like to know why. I do recommend giving this place a try though. It's a lot of fun regardless of the sub par bartending.

0aq2XOgwAKkJp5DNwVzHbA.text: Tried to charge us a cover just to eat dinner at 7:00 on a friday. We didn't stay and won't be back.

0ZCmDYwXVyhwrGqYudQLmA.text: Been here several times now!!! GREAT experience! Every dish my wife and I have ordered has been on-spot and fantastic. I had seen the early reviews about service, but didn't experience any issues any of the times we were there. I even mentioned something to one of the waitresses about it and she said it was "1st night gitters". They have apparently corrected their hiccups. The staff was very friendly and the live music was awesome. This is exactly what the South Hills has needed!

pnU7J8GRqNeNAuVip34dGw.text: First time we went took an hour to get drinks, my friends never got their food or what they ordered.  Gave it another try, did not get to sit with out party. My daughter's food was given to the wrong table. Took 20 minutes to get drinks and the place was empty. So could not understand why they where still sooo slow with service.   Food was cold. Appetizer came out with out with our meal so my husband no longer even wanted it.

snaQFmxw3n64c84wSAmutw.text: Beer selections were good.  Bar staff was pleasant.  Food was not very impressive.  Like to see it on a good Friday or Saturday night.  Looks like the kind of place that party's down.

wCHZzcEplZpBnDK-SX28Fw.text: Terrible. Worst experience I've ever had. I usually read negative reviews and laugh because I can't believe someone's experience could have been that bad until last night. Complete chaos, can't call it had service case there was NO service. One star rating from valets and on. Nothing could make me go there again. They need to close, rehire and retrain and reopen.

_yAk0wa7FOnmSs0PORPTlg.text: One waitress was very rude, saying "You can't be served without being at a table" even though we were seated. The service was slow...took 30+ minutes to get a menu. Ordered a draft and was given a bottle. Also we noticed that the prices on the menu did not match prices on the receipt; this is totally unacceptable. Place has lots of potential however.

p3AFhELGIVedOJZqEOPGEg.text: This place is awesome! Friendly service, great food, live music, and a vast beer offering. Will definitely will be back. Word to the wise- order the crispy potato skin. They are insanely delicious!

-dTTEh-cSEUIxJ2K-q3IGw.text: Good food, decent beer menu, nice to have another place for bands to play. Service was decent for a busy Saturday nite. Docked two stars for devoting so much parking space to valet. I never choose valet; nothing screams pretentious like valet parking. And Curry Rd and pretentious don't go together. On the way in overheard a couple of valet parkers complaining about customers complaining about them. I'll go back but not soon mainly because of the parking situation.

OXj0PNXUX5Yu3vFLUMH5cA.text: We went on opening night because we read in a local newspaper about all of the remodeling they did. As soon as we got there we were greeted by a hostess and seated. They told us that they had a limited menu which seemed odd considering this was the grand opening. We all ordered hamburgers and asked that they be cooked well done and we also all ordered the fresh cut french fries. Once the food arrived, it was served on a metal lunch tray which was reminiscent of a prison tray. I assume they don't have plates. The presentation of the meal was terrible as everything was just thrown on the metal tray. As I looked at my burger, I noticed there was blood all over the bottom bun. I cut that part off and cut into my burger which wasn't anywhere near well done let alone anywhere near medium. The bun was also cold and must've just been taken out of a bag. My friend sent her meal back because her cheese burger was so pink inside. The waitress was courteous and brought out another cheese burger however this one was half the size of the original burger and was burnt like a charcoal brick. The cook also just threw two pieces of cold cheese on this burger. They at least melted the cheese on the original but this one was presented with two slices of cheese just thrown on top. As far as the "fresh cut" french fries go, they were simply frozen french fries that they just threw in a deep fryer. The burgers had no flavor and neither did the fries. The food was extremely plain and poorly made. Each burger was $13 and definitely not worth the price. I won't be going back to this place.

I6v49fxTIcjjxYCSyXztvw.text: Firstly, the service is great and the sound system is terrific. They have a nice dance floor, too.  That said, the DJ is insane with the bass.  It is all you can hear/feel and the volume is entirely too loud.  If you want to have any conversation while eating, it's impossible. And keep in mind this DJ is controlling the music before the band comes on as well as during the breaks- it's horrible!  Then, he had the stage speakers turned up so loudly that people who had waited for the band had to leave when they finally started. It makes it extremely difficult to have an enjoyable time.

4I_PsHKawLRyxy2b8VhhMw.text: C'mon! Fire this disc jockey.  Freaking terrible.  You have a great band with ARTISTREE but then the dj kills the mood with poor song selection and all bass mumble rap or obscure low tempo crowd killing music.  Too loud, all bass.  Our waitress is great but I hate this venue because of this dj

DyGaFQYnEJ-ne5qY3ahe2A.text: Fun small venue. Had a great waitress first, but then switched tables to be closer the the stage. It was not in our current server's section - we felt bad, but tipped her VERY well. Second waitress? Did not say a word - ever. Just kept walking by with attitude. No problem, we're easy going - just went to the bar. Probably accrued a tab that tripled the first, but walked 2 feet to the bar for food and drinks. Tipped even better to the bar staff. Actually happy we kept the waitress who was too good for us' table all night!

DxvXy8lDCu1ebxxBCJQsIg.text: Went on a Wednesday night for dinner.  The dueling pianos were so loud it was difficult to have a conversation. Decent menu but too few options for a vegetarian and even the fries were undercooked. Overall not a good choice for dinner if you want to talk to your companions.

R-c54Lm_vJl86CYbjGo8_g.text: I have been to Crafthouse several times The food is normally very good, but the service is extremely slow. My party and I have waited upwards of an hour for food or drinks to arrive. The restaurant and bar are constantly understaffed.  When they have music or play a sporting event the volume is far too loud to hold a conversation.

OVlm2pecJDsAohqx_gb-SQ.text: Food is good, not great. Dry rub wings are worth trying. Nice atmosphere with connecting businesses, but timely and efficient service is rare at this place.

OYNvfnVgJk29VjxxeA0Axg.text: We wanted to hear Bon Journey play and dance to their music. The end of the night was great and the dance floor was hopping. The band was great and music was awesome! We arrived early for appetizers and drinks, unfortunately we did not know that you had to reserve a table for the whole night. We had a great drinks and munchies at Spoonwood Brewery (right down the road) and came back to dance the night away. We'll be back but will plan ahead next time.

9r08PQ5BU3VcoBcBLxBPRA.text: Place has improved with their menu but their beer selection has slipped a little. They don't offer as many unique brews as they once did. More or less the same offering you get at every craft beer bar. But I have to put a special mention to our waitress Jessica last night. She took over for Maya who, one her second day, did a good job. She introduced Jessica to us when she was finished. We ordered a drink and told her we were there to see the band. In the 1+ hour that we sat at our table after the initial introduction, we saw Jessica ZERO TIMES!!!  She never asked how we were doing and if we needed anything to drink, which was obvious because of all the empty glasses around us. Finally we went to the bar to get served, and we had great service at the bar. After sitting at the bar for about 45 minutes someone tapped on my shoulder. It was Jessica handing me the bill for the one drink we had when she was supposed to be waiting on us. Never an apology for not checking on us. Nothing but "Here's your tab."  We frequent crafthouse a lot. We'll be sure to steer away from Jessica in the future.

ipPuwlzNINDkHTmBO7ryjA.text: Only stopped in briefly for a drink but great atmosphere and great staff. Short visit but a fun time.

6D42IBCXPWTX_uZGCSJ4Vg.text: Love this place. The only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is that there isn't as much seating as I'd like. The couches are lovely but impossible if you want to eat.   All in all, I've never had a bad time there. It's so nice to have a cool place like this so close to home.

EdN3fbM6cYIJ1gBtZhcuTg.text: Great place!  Bar seats about 50 people, room for about 150 more at tables and floor.  Live bands, great sound system, great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7EDtbi5tZRHvA3qGNL3mTw.text: Crafthouse is the perfect example of when a business can't stick with one idea and seems to fail everywhere else.  Upon arriving I noticed the valet, which seemed very out of place. I really disliked this; not only is the idea of a valet silly in a place where parking is a breeze but it feels cheap.   The restaurant itself was very nice and new, unfortunately smelled like wet paint--not so appetizing. There was a live band the evening of my visit but the restaurant was just about half way full, perhaps they should section parts off? It just seemed sad to have a good band playing to a dead room.   I ordered the buffalo chicken salad; it was nothing more than chicken fingers on a bed of ice burg lettuce, not the bed of mixed greens as advertised. It wasn't awful but absolutely not worth the $14/15 it cost. Those I was with agreed that the food was bland and very overpriced.  Our service wasn't bad and the drinks were good but ultimately over priced and in need of better direction by management.

S2lFpfkl1Z55HUzoh6ULRQ.text: Second time here. The food is passable. The service tonight is better than last time. The bands both times suck. Nice dance floor but they don't seem to be able to attract bands that actually work the crowd or play music that you can dance to.

BO2If0tYhuHx67zYen3vfA.text: If zero stars was an option, this place would get it. Went to see Cold Hard Cash and had the tickets since December. Get there at 7:15 and waited for 20-25 min to get in. They had folding chairs set up near the stage, and they were completely full or covered in coats and bags from people saving them for others. There were no tables or seats at the bar. I asked a waitress where we were supposed to sit and she said everything was first come, first serve. I'm not sure what having a ticket did for us. They had the couches "reserved" as others have posted. Cold Hard Cash was amazing, but we couldn't stay for the show because we were so uncomfortable from standing for 2 and a half hours. Not one waitress or bar tender offered us anything. We won't ever go back.

tbGO6sTciTqoAobOeBt9mA.text: At our second visit, we were dismayed to find out that they have done away with two of our favorite menu items.  The seared ahi tuna tacos are gone, replaced with Thai shrimp tacos with "Asian mushroom slaw", which sounded good but tasted like it was out of a can, watery and metallic-tasting.  The truffle fries are still on the menu, but the fries they have made them with have changed.  They used to be ultra-crispy, almost like they were breaded.  Now they are "hand-cut", which is harder to pull off.  The result was limp and greasy, albeit truffley and cheesy.  Also, the food took forever to arrive.  Still, my hubby's Creole pasta was tasty, and the beer selection was still top notch, so he was happy.  But the establishment's shiny first experience has certainly dimmed a bit.  What will our third visit hold for us?

jUXEuaWbjoSanZrGH5Tugg.text: Honestly I never knew this place was there until a friend told us about it. It is pretty hidden in the suburbs of the South Hills.  We got there early on a Friday night as they have a great happy hour special.  Select draft beers were 1/2 off  and they have a very nice selection. I went with a Vermont beer that was a pineapple shandy. It was a little flat so for my next beer I went with the McKenzie's Black Cherry cider which never disappoints.  Select appetizers (only about 4) were 1/2 off and we went with the boneless buffalo wings. They have many sauces to choose from and we stuck with the traditional buffalo sauce served with blue cheese. I was extremely impressed as the wings were not fried and great quality chicken.  I ordered the buffalo chicken flatbread as my entree=-it was a 1/2 price appetizer and to be honest not very good. There was too much cheese and the flatbread was very doughy.  I blame myself for ordering the wrong thing and I should have stuck with ordering a salad or burger.  My fiance got the chicken gyro wrap with fries. He was extremely happy with his choice and the fries are fresh cut and top notch.  Our waitress  was fantastic and I would go back and order something different next time.  A band was playing later that night but we got in before it got crowded and the cover charge started.

kMZMLrbJl90tpq6-v8jxQQ.text: Used to love it here, but tonight not so much. Out of multiple main stay liquors. Changed my favorite recipe and you could not even hear the band in the whole back half of bar.

yoTcn62BEFIds10ISm4qgQ.text: Have visited a few times now and really love it. The food is top notch. You have to try the candied bacon.  Service is top notch and it's super clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmmm bacon.

5eER15PG81uIRq8sHFvPaw.text: I was at the Craft House Friday night and got there early (6:30) since we had a group of seven.  Upon entering, we saw a car parked on the snowy hillside looking like it would topple over with a slight push.  When I got inside, I learned it was a friend's car parked on the hill and she used valet!   I kept thinking they better not park my brand new car in that area.  The valet lot was empty!  I pushed the thought aside but guess where it was parked?  Directly behind my friend right up against the bumper sideways on that hill!  This is a great venue for live entertainment but I will not deal with that parking arrangement!  Get rid of valet!

89D9sgVyy9QzhzEu6lYIDg.text: This place is pretty great.  50 beers on draft.  Nice Happy Hour specials on drinks and food.  Stayed for the band that came on at 9.  Nice little stage and dance area.  Overall, high grades for my first visit since the renovation.

68Og0SUerfEvxMFHTpwq4Q.text: So this was my first time here and I was pleasantly surprised. It's a cool venue (with an attached bowling alley) that has a bar and restaurant style seating with a pretty kick ass sound system for the national acts that come through to play here. The staff is really nice and professional. No matter how busy they got the bartenders never ignored me and even took the time to let me try a couple of pours I'd never had before. They have quite a selection of beers too. Very impressive. Also the prices weren't terrible at all! I expected to pay a lot more than I did. Not complaining at all about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KCCOg9nGEMqwv5aqPocmAQ.text: Come out to see Dirty Shirley and had a great time.  The place is big with a high ceiling so the volume wasn't all that loud (but we were at a front table so while they played- we couldn't talk much).  They have a huge draft/beer list and the bartenders are fast.  It's a great venue for music.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. First Degree, 1st opener for Rehab...

jlYjOKCJDe9MVWHwBLDn1Q.text: A great place to see live bands in the South Hills. Tonight was Metal Church, a band still around after 30 years bringing metal to the masses. Haven't tried the food yet, but that will be soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BykU65LYVrxx-zchTF3gYA.text: Best large preztel I've had. Made my night. Anyone looking to soak up your alcohols with food this is the right portion. 19 bucks. They also offer free valet. Sound is amazing. Can see the stage from the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bavarian pretzel 19 bucks

axtCEjQXeQTd_Fuh6GVW7A.text: I've recently started coming here for shows. I like the fact that you can order some drinks and food during the concert. My advice is to get here early though because you will not get a seat otherwise and will awkwardly stand around waiting for set changes. Same goes for parking, they do offer valet services but that's not my style, I like to park my own vehicle. Early is key if you're coming on the night of a fairly popular act. The food isn't bad but the choices are limited to only a few selections, prices are higher than they should be and service is slow because I think they are understaffed. Overall a fun experience, I will be back for shows.

fdkUpaINB9xDKeIBHS-79A.text: I just find it extremely difficult to rate the food here - my best advice is come here for entertaining- don't eat The loosely food - if you can even call it that. The cover charge is way too high - omg they even tie your car here

3tnPqKXVMh3Z2F2IB_2Wjg.text: I would never go here again. Service is the absolute worst. This clown bartender provided the worst service ever and shouldn't be employed as a janitor. I would never come here again under any circumstances. Food was terrible, service was worse.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

70t17aHRNhpDOzk466eZfw.text: Came here for the first time on a Saturday night. There was six of us and four of us arrived before 7 so we were not charged cover for the band that was playing. Our other two friends arrived at 6:57 and they charged them for some odd reason. I would have questioned it but they didn't seem to mind. The band did not start playing until 9 and it seems to get pretty crowded around 8. Our waitress was very nice and attentive even on a busy night. We ordered drinks and I asked for a mojito. My mojito tasted like pure water and mint. Luckily she was nice enough to take it off the tab and get me a different drink which was very well made the next time. I ordered the chicken wrap with aioli and truffle fries. I thought everything tasted amazing! Loved the food! Our whole table loved their food as well! The food did take a long time to come out though. Staff throughout the venue was very friendly. I can say some things on the menu and drinks can be pricy. They do have weekly happy hour and weekly specials so that is nice. We had fun gathering with friends and it's nice that they have decent musical guests come here often. We would probably come back when there are more specials going on to save a few bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken wrap and truffle fries

scdCfxizSMZF_bIgqr59Fw.text: I've been here a couple times, once with live music and another time of Tuesday Bingo night. I didn't play bingo but there seemed to be a good crowd.  Huge beer selection. Mixed drinks and wine available too but the beer selection is the main thing you should come food. Food is good for bar food. Not many options for vegetarians. Clean large bathrooms. Lots of parking, valet at times. Service was quick when I've been here. Attached to the bowling alley and escape room I believe. Lots of events throughout the week. Biggest draw is the beer selection and events. Check it out!

dcRCijzKDUHa7lM-y2Os_w.text: Sticker Shock!!! Very Expensive! I just visited this Pittsburgh South suburban establishment for the first time yesterday, Feb. 15th to see the Pink Floyd tribute band, Pitt Floyd. When I received my bar bill at the end of the night I was in for a shocking unpleasant surprise. They charge me $7.50 for a pint of Guiness(U.S. Pint not Imperial) and $7 for a pint of Bluepoint Toasted Lager. If this restaurant was in downtown New York or Boston then I would expect those prices, but it's located on a back street in a middle class neighborhood, attached to a bowling alley about 15 miles south of downtown Pittsburgh. No where on the menu or beer list to they list the prices. Typical downtown Pittsburgh beer prices is $5 a pint. I also ordered food. I ordered a beef brisket sandwich and fries for $12. Thought the brisket was very tasty they skimped on the portion. One layer of brisket which did not make it to the edges of the bun, but the crispy onion rings did. So that's what you mostly taste. On a positive note ... I sat at the bar and the service was excellent. Plus .... It is an excellent place to see live music. The sound system was crystal clear and didn't blow out my eardrums. And the sightlines from any where in the bar is good. Overall ... Bar and Food 1 star Music Venue 4 stars

VsX99_LrCCLsXUBlu7Kicg.text: Best date night spot! Great bands, great beers, the roast beef nachos are ahhhmazing! Staff is so fun and friendly. We love it here!

RARonrKbXCTIgCtVqaNPqg.text: My boyfriend and I went here to see his friend's band. We were going to eat elsewhere but figured we would eat here to save time. MAJOR MISTAKE. I ordered the craft house shrimp salad $16.95 for some lettuce and 5 pieces of shrimp. BEST PART: on the bill it was $18.95. My bf ordered shrimp tacos $10.95, got chicken $9.95... no big deal until we see on the bill it's $11.95 plus $5.95 for a side salad. Basically there was an up charge of $2 on everything (even our drinks) which the manager said was because they didn't print updated menus for the event. We just let it go and told each other we will never be back. We dine out a lot and NEVER were the prices on the menu higher on the bill. Whatever is printed on the menu should be what you pay or you should be warned before you order that prices will be higher. This is extremely deceptive and absolute horrible business practice. I thought this place was cute and that I wanted to come back with friends but I will never come back after how we were treated by management. The server was good until we asked for the menu after we got our bill and she sent the manager over and then took forever to give us change, etc. Apparently it's offensive when you question why EVERYTHING you ordered was $2  more. I've never experienced anything like this before.

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $18.95 Shrimp Salad

D_B_DXS6T-K0g5Dr19Z0mw.text: I came here for the Thursday night line dancing. I was visiting my parents from Southern California, where I go line dancing regularly, and was having a very difficult time finding anywhere in Pittsburgh that offered line dancing. After a difficult search, I found the Crafthouse. Given that this is the one of the only places in town that offers line dancing, I'm surprised that it isn't more heavily advertised.   Anyways, they offer lessons the first and third Thursday of the month. There is a DJ, but no live bands the 2 nights I went. They also play mostly line dances and very few partner/couple dances.  The Crafthouse is nice, but smaller than the country bars I'm used to. There are definitely regulars that know all the dances, and they were all very friendly! I will be returning when I come to visit my parents next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Crafthouse Stage & Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UpTAy24pSnIglL5QpS_qRQ.text: What a diamond! We went here for a pretty late meal and their kitchen was still open at 10:00 pm. Their buffalo chicken wrap was amazing (their sauce was spicy and sweet). You have to upgrade your fries to the truffle parmesan fries.   The service was also great! The music and line dancing was... interesting but it is definitely a place to try out!

s96PL5x_UrBUjA8o7ORZxw.text: Decided to check this place out for an early dinner on a Saturday around 5. The exterior could really use a paint job.  Once inside, we found no one at the hostess station, but there was a group of people there for an event, I assume. They were dressed like wedding guests and were getting drinks from the bar.  We stood around for a few minutes and no one greeted us. So we left with a terrible first impression.

C9AVqYdAARuhvfq_DcuR-g.text: I had my wedding after-party at the Crafthouse and it was so much fun! We rented 10 lanes, got a bunch of pizza and everyone had a great time! Working with Amanda was awesome and helped us plan everything.

adKQTKsJeR8_fMN-10ZqqA.text: Had a great time.  Didnt eat dinner there.  But the band was great. Would definitely come back

TWJ8isp-0DdGLzeLQIFFqg.text: Nice place but I think the parking is a scam with the shopping center across the street. Went to see Sponge a few months ago and had my car towed away from across the street. Did not know about valet because I turned into the first parking lot on the site. Will probably go back eventually, but will Uber. Once bitten twice shy...

UwoeRHvMs5KQNiDtoxU5kw.text: Just a confusing place. Nobody home to answer phones the day of a concert even an hour before doors open. It's a bar with happy hour (but not on the nights they have music), they also have bowling (not open on music nights either, possibly?). The whole operations is problematic if you don't know and you drive there. Further, they have an 'event' food menu which increases the already expensive food prices another 20%. $18 for a salad with chicken, $19 for a big pretzel? Its just stressful for concerts because you want to take a table (there's a small GA floor up front too), but then you get asked about food/drink all night. Much easier to go to just about any other venue for music I'd say. Oh and my beer was very rough. They told me it was the end of the keg and I suspect it's been the same keg for a WHILE. Also, it's disingenuous to not list beer prices on the menu only to find out they're inflated beyond the already high prices posted online.  As far as the sound, good god is it too loud. I bought high quality ear plugs because I go to lots of concerts, usually Metal. And I'd say even with them in it's too loud. It's just insulting to people in the crowd. People's hearing is important and I can't begin to understand what would motivate them to mix shows this way.  Sorry for being harsh, I love going to concerts and the whole logistical nightmare and price gouging is just a bit too much to swallow.

6CslzkCBkAYM99WXtBtcDw.text: Food and atmosphere is good.   They need to address the policy on band members saving tables. I was third in line waiting at the door and only to find that band members had saved 12 seats in the front row. This is a terrible practice. Keep in mind I'm a paying customer who purchased tickets and has dropped $150 before the band has not even started.   Crafthouse please change your practices.
